Because of the government shutdown, we now have military members protecting our country and not getting paid. Congress should be held to the same standards as everyone else. I will not take my pay during the shutdown and have notified the appropriate officer in the House.

I have also been calling for and working towards an immediate & bipartisan DACA solution. I helped introduce bipartisan legislation called the USA Act this week to do just that. DACA deadline is March & we can continue this important policy discussion with an open government.

Businesses announce raising the minimum wage and bonuses for their employees after the tax relief bill passes Congress. https://t.co/dXLZoW7V18

My voice and my vote reflects what my constituents need and feel – more money in their paychecks, a healthier economy that helps everyone, and better positioning for American companies to grow and compete in the global economy.

I've listened to everyone who has called, emailed, written. I’ve heard from families& I’ve spent time w small business owners, who have told me over & over this will put more money back in the pockets of their workers, stimulate more jobs, & help them improve/ grow their business

A typical family of four earning the median family income of $73,000 will receive a tax cut of $2,059. The average single mom in America makes around $41,000. Under this legislation, she will receive a tax cut of over $1,300.
Tuition waivers for graduate students will remain untaxed. We have preserved the medical expense deduction and even expanded it for two years.

There are so many myths that persist, & I would like to clear up a few of them. Teacher supplies deduction remains. Child tax credit has been expanded. Charitable deduction continues& expands. We have maintained earned income tax credit. We improved savings accounts for education

For those itemizing on their tax return, up to 10k is still able to be deducted from property/income taxes, along w mortgage interest deduction; when you combine w lower income tax brackets& higher income thresholds, the overwhelming majority of my constituents will get a tax cut
Middle income families will benefit from lower rates and doubling the child tax credit - to name just a few policies.

American workers are the lynchpin of a healthy economy. Employers provide the capital and take the risk to create value in services and products. Families are the backbone of our society. For all of them, we need an economy that invests in people and rewards hard work.
Here's why I'm voting yes on the tax bill: https://t.co/6E6tFpTVN4
